intro: Houstonia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Houstonia micrantha is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is an important component of native plant communities.
